result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas K Gast was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

AODA Assessment and follow-through.  
Absolute Sobriety,  
Must give DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Nicholas K Gast in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/ NC plea. Atty Haacke agrees w/probation, argues lesser amount and remaining conditions, requests expungement.  ADA Niemi argues against expungement.  DE addresses the Court.  Court pronounces sentence, does not grant expungement. Appeal & Voting rights given to DE.
